title: Fixes Banynadb race condition
body:
### Fix #9359

The issue exists because BanyanDBBatchDAO is used by multiple threads but `initialized.compareAndSet(false, true)` is set before the values it's supposed to initialize are actually initialized.

My method of multithreaded protection probably isn't the best, but it works. Let me know if I should use another method.

title: Revert #8066 introduced in 8.9.0

- [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #<issue number>.
- [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/changes/changes.md).

Revert the following changes in 8.9.0's PR #8066
____
Optimize metrics of minute dimensionality persistence.
- The value of metrics, which has declaration of the default value and current value equals the default value logically, the whole row wouldn't be pushed into database.
- Add self-observability `metrics_persistence_skipped` metric to measure the number of skipped metrics.
- SLA(percent function), Apdex, AvgLong(MAL mostly) metrics are mostly optimized because of this. Such as a full-failing error(0% successful rate) and unhealthy(apdex=0) are not costing the storage.
- Hour/Day dimensionalities metrics are not changed, as they cover long duration.
- Fix `max` function in OAL doesn't support negative long.
____

This optimization makes a side-effect, reported by @toffentoffen, the typical use case is shown in the demo env.
![Screenshot 2022-07-12 at 11 39 11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/178534028-137a9494-f9cf-4d92-9d47-35c7c45e261d.png)

This service has only 66% success rate, but when you read the endpoint success rate list(DESC order), you can only see all are 100%. This is very confusing. 
**The root cause** is the above optimization, if an entity(in this case, an endpoint)'s success rate is 0%, the metric is not persistent. Then when we do topN aggregation query, there is no available data to list, even its success rate is pretty low.
Meanwhile, if you query in hour/day level, it would show up, which makes ppl more confusing.

So, to keep things simpler, and as the success rate is the only metric that could be optimized through this PR, I am going to revert this optimization, and keep all aggregated metrics in the storage consistently.

title: Add `forEach`, `processRelation` function to MAL Expression, and add `expPrefix` in MAL config
body:
I'm preparing network profiling based on eBPF, it needs to complete the process relation through MAL. 
1. Add `forEach`, `processRelation` function to MAL Expression.
2. Add `expPrefix` in MAL config.
3. Add `ProcessRegistry` to generate the process dynamically. 

Here is an example, I will add the configuration after the network analysis function is complete.
```yaml
expSuffix: |-
  processRelation('side', ['service'], ['instance'], 'client_process_id', 'server_process_id')
expPrefix: |-
  forEach(['client', 'server'], { prefix, tags ->
    if (tags[prefix + '_process_id'] != null) {
      return
    }
    if (tags[prefix + '_local'] == 'true') {
      tags[prefix + '_process_id'] = ProcessRegistry.generateVirtualLocalProcess(tags.service, tags.instance)
      return
    }
    tags[prefix + '_process_id'] = ProcessRegistry.generateVirtualRemoteProcess(tags.service, tags.instance, tags[prefix + '_address'])
  })
metricPrefix: network_profiling
metricsRules:
  - name: write_bytes
    exp:  rover_network_monitor_write_bytes_counter.sum(['service', 'instance', 'side', 'client_process_id', 'server_process_id'])
```

title: Fix scroll query in Elastic Search storage
body:
### Fix Scroll query in Elastic Search storage
If the `SW_STORAGE_ES_SCROLLING_BATCH_SIZE` environment config is less them the Service entity count, it would throw `No search context found for id` exception. The root cause is we're going to close the scroll after we've requested it once. 

### Add `profileDataQueryBatchSize` config in Elastic Search storage
EBPF Profiling Data stores a large amount of symbol data. When a large amount of data content is queried at one time, a `ContentTooLargeException` from netty will occur, so I add a new config for the query.
